t: Matthew 11
John the Baptist Sends Messengers to Jesus
Now*p it came to pass, when Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.
And*p when John had heard in prison about the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples
and said to Him, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “Go*r and*r tell*r John*r the*r things*r which*r you*r hear*r and*r see:*r

The*ir blind*r see*r and*r the*ir lame*r walk;*r the*ir lepers*r are*r cleansed*r and*r the*ir deaf*r hear;*r the*ir dead*r are*r raised*r up*r and*r the*ir poor*r have*r the*r gospel*r preached*r to*r them.*r
And*r blessed*r is*r he*r who*r is*r not*r offended*r because*r of*r Me.”*r
As*p they departed, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John: “What*r did*r you*r go*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r shaken*r by*r the*r wind?*r
But*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r clothed*r in*r soft*r garments?*r Indeed,*r those*r who*r wear*r soft*r clothing*ir are*r in*r kings’*r houses.*r
But*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yes,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r and*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
For*r this*r is*r he*ir of*r whom*r it*r is*r written:*r ‘Behold,*rpn I*r send*r My*r messenger*r before*r Your*r face,*r Who*rld will*r prepare*r Your*r way*r before*r You.’*r

“Assuredly,*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r among*r those*r born*r of*r women*r there*r has*r not*r risen*r one*r greater*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist;*r but*r he*r who*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r greater*r than*r he.*r
And*r from*r the*r days*r of*r John*r the*r Baptist*r until*r now*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r suffers*r violence,*r and*r the*r violent*r take*r it*r by*r force.*r
For*r all*r the*r prophets*r and*r the*r law*r prophesied*r until*r John.*r
And*r if*r you*r are*r willing*r to*r receive*r it,*ir he*r is*r Elijah*r who*r is*r to*r come.*r
He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear!*r
“But*rp to*r what*r shall*r I*r liken*r this*r generation?*r It*r is*r like*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r marketplaces*r and*r calling*r to*r their*r companions,*r
and saying: ‘We*rpn played*r the*r flute*r for*r you,*r And*rld you*r did*r not*r dance;*r We*rld mourned*r to*r you,*r And*rld you*r did*r not*r lament.’*r
For*rp John*r came*r neither*r eating*r nor*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘He*r has*r a*r demon.’*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r came*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘Look,*r a*r glutton*r and*r a*r winebibber,*r a*r friend*r of*r tax*r collectors*r and*r sinners!’*r But*r wisdom*r is*r justified*r by*r her*r children.”*r
Woe to the Impenitent Cities
Then*p He began to rebuke the cities in which most of His mighty works had been done, because they did not repent:

“Woe*r to*r you,*r Chorazin!*r Woe*r to*r you,*r Bethsaida!*r For*r if*r the*r mighty*r works*r which*r were*r done*r in*r you*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon,*r they*r would*r have*r repented*r long*r ago*r in*r sackcloth*r and*r ashes.*r
But*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r it*r will*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon*r in*r the*r day*r of*r judgment*r than*r for*r you.*r

And*r you,*r Capernaum,*r who*r are*r exalted*r to*r heaven,*r will*r be*r brought*r down*r to*r Hades;*r for*r if*r the*r mighty*r works*r which*r were*r done*r in*r you*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Sodom,*r it*r would*r have*r remained*r until*r this*r day.*r
But*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r it*r shall*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r the*r land*r of*r Sodom*r in*r the*r day*r of*r judgment*r than*r for*r you.”*r
Jesus Gives True Rest

At*p that time Jesus answered and said, “I*r thank*r You,*r Father,*r Lord*r of*r heaven*r and*r earth,*r that*r You*r have*r hidden*r these*r things*r from*r the*ir wise*r and*r prudent*r and*r have*r revealed*r them*r to*r babes.*r
Even*r so,*r Father,*r for*r so*r it*r seemed*r good*r in*r Your*r sight.*r

All*r things*r have*r been*r delivered*r to*r Me*r by*r My*r Father,*r and*r no*r one*r knows*r the*r Son*r except*r the*r Father.*r Nor*r does*r anyone*r know*r the*r Father*r except*r the*r Son,*r and*r the*ir one*ir to*r whom*r the*r Son*r wills*r to*r reveal*r Him.*ir
Come*r to*r Me,*r all*r you*ir who*r labor*r and*r are*r heavy*r laden,*r and*r I*r will*r give*r you*r rest.*r
Take*r My*r yoke*r upon*r you*r and*r learn*r from*r Me,*r for*r I*r am*r gentle*r and*r lowly*r in*r heart,*r and*r you*r will*r find*r rest*r for*r your*r souls.*r
For*r My*r yoke*r is*ir easy*r and*r My*r burden*r is*r light.”*r
